title: FD-TRANSFER: Research file descriptor transfer mechanisms
description:
Investigate how to implement file descriptor transfer in Rust:

- Research the `sendfd` crate capabilities and API
- Understand Unix domain socket ancillary data for fd passing
- Learn Rust patterns for sending/receiving multiple descriptors
- Study descriptor lifecycle management
- Investigate error handling for fd transfer failures

Goal: Understand complete fd transfer flow from client to daemon.

title: EXECUTION-CONTEXT: Research execution context serialization
description:
Research how to serialize and transfer execution context:

- Context components: command, args, cwd, descriptors
- Serialization format for socket transfer
- Working directory handling
- Argument array management
- Descriptor mapping and restoration
- Error handling for invalid contexts

Research needed:
- Rust serialization libraries (serde, bincode, etc.)
- Cross-platform compatibility considerations
- Security implications of context transfer
- Validation of execution context

Goal: Design efficient, secure context transfer protocol.

title: Research: Foundation research for prefork system
description: Foundation research for the entire prefork system. This epic contains all research tickets needed to understand the technologies and patterns we'll use.

title: DAEMON-LIFECYCLE: Research daemonization and process management
description:
Research Rust daemon patterns:

- `fork` crate usage and capabilities
- Double-fork technique for background processes
- PID file management in XDG locations
- Process termination and cleanup
- Auto-launch daemon on demand (--create/-C option)
- Daemon health checking via PID files

Research needed:
- PID file creation and locking
- Daemon startup validation
- Process group management
- Signal handling for graceful shutdown

Goal: Understand robust daemon lifecycle management.

title: SOCKET-DISCOVERY: Research Unix domain socket discovery patterns
description:
Research strategies for locating the daemon socket:

- Local file mode: `./pfd.sock` or `.pfd.sock`
- XDG runtime mode: `$XDG_RUNTIME_DIR/pfd.sock`
- XDG-project mode: `$XDG_RUNTIME_DIR/pfd.<project-name>.sock`

Research needed:
- Rust `directories` crate for XDG paths
- Socket file naming conventions
- Fallback strategies between modes
- Socket creation permissions and ownership
- Atomic operations for socket file management

Goal: Design robust multi-mode discovery system.

title: prefork-democli: Build pre-fork daemon and client system
description:
A client/server pre-fork system for Rust:
- `pfd` (daemon): Receives execution contexts and file descriptors, runs commands
- `pfc` (client): Transfers execution context to daemon and terminates

Execution context includes: command, args, cwd, and file descriptors (stdin/stdout/stderr)

Key features:
- File descriptor transfer via Unix domain sockets
- Multiple discovery strategies (local, XDG, XDG-project)
- Auto-launch daemon on demand
- Minimal client footprint
